string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111001101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to this presentation on vocabulary techniques. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="To navigate through this presentation, click the tiles on the bottom of the screen to jump to a specific technique. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click the R tile at the top right of the screen to view additional resources. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You can jump back to the title screen by clicking the house tile, learn more about the pedagogy and best practices of vocabulary instruction by clicking the book tile, or test your knowledge by clicking the test tile. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click a tile on the bottom of the screen to see the techniques." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to this course on Vocabulary Instruction and Techniques. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="There are 3 modules in this course. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In the first module, you will learn about the pedagogy and best practices of vocabulary instruction. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In the 2nd module, you will see many different techniques you can use to introduce, practice and review vocabulary with your students. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="And finally in the 3rd module, you will test your knowledge by suggesting strategies and techniques for three different scenarios and explain your reasoning with support from the first module. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If youd like to see more resources on vocabulary instruction and techniques, click the R tile at any time to jump to the resources slide. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click the Instruction tile to begin. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Lets start with a pre-test! 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Define the terms in your own words. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If you arent sure of the meaning or you dont know the full definition of the word, take a guess or write any details that come to mind when you read the word. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre finished click SUBMIT on the form.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click NEXT to continue.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="How do you introduce new vocabulary? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Take a second to reflect on how you normally introduce your new vocabulary words to your students.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre ready, click NEXT to continue. 
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="As we discussed at the beginning of this module, there are many ways to introduce new vocabulary. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You could do a pre-test (as we just did), 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="you could introduce new vocabulary in the context of a reading assignment or in the lecture where you can explain the meaning and correct misunderstandings immediately, 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="you could play vocabulary games to introduce the new words 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="or you could give students a list of vocabulary words and their definitions. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="While all of these methods may have a place and time, theres one method Id like to discourage you from using to introduce new words to your students.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to continue. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Which of the following methods shouldnt you use to introduce new vocabulary?" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Take a look at this quote from Robert Marzano: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="AtLeast" LineSpacing="0" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" Start="0" Color="#000000,00" BulletChar="" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="When students copy the teacher's explanation or description of a term instead of generating their own explanation, the results are not as strong. Ideally, student explanations should come from their own lives. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When students write down and define the terms in their own words, they are actively building their knowledge rather than passively accepting it. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="A vocabulary list with definitions may be useful as a study guide in that it tells students WHAT to study, but it doesnt actually help them with our first big take-away 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to find out what our first important take-away is.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Retrieval!
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Were you able to come up with a definition for retrieval on the pre-test? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Retrieval is act of trying to recall something from memory without looking at your notes or re-reading. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Things like flashcard drilling, re-writing what you remember from notes you took without looking, and taking closed-book quizzes are all examples of retrieval practice.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This brings us to our big picture concept for this course. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Whats the difference between Assessment FOR learning and Assessment OF learning? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="At first it may seem like just semantics, but the difference is very important. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="With retrieval practice, we are testing our students and encouraging our students to test themselves so that they will learn the material BETTER. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This is assessment FOR learning learning through tests, quizzes and other low-stakes assignments that force students to retrieve information. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Assessment OF learning is like the final test. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This is used to see what students know at a particular time and usually it is connected to a grade. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="While Assessment OF learning is definitely beneficial to metacognition and identifying gaps in knowledge, unless paired with quality feedback, assessment OF learning, usually does not lead to better learning. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to find out more.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Lets practice retrieval now! 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="How many words from the pre-test can you remember? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Use the text fields below to type in as many of the vocabulary words as you can remember. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You will have 30 seconds. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Ready? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="3-2-1 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="GO!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Times up! 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="How many could you remember? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Why did you remember the words you did? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Maybe you remembered the last word on the list, maybe you made some connection to something else that had a similar meaning or sounded the same, or maybe you already knew something about those words. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Whatever the case, retrieval of this information helps to solidify these words in your working memory.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If youd like to see a follow up activity that you can use in the classroom, click the Classroom Activity link here. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Or click NEXT to continue.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Before you see a list of the words again, if you were doing this activity with your students, this would be a good time to ask them to share notes with a partner. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="After trying to recall as many words as they can, allow students to compare their list with a neighbors and add any words their partner remembered that they missed. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This gives students another opportunity to make connections with the words and further commit them to memory.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to see the full list of words.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Now that youve assessed your understanding, lets find out what these words really mean. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click on a word in the list to see the definition of each word.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Read the definition and on the Google Form, type in an example of the word. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Make sure you click SUBMIT on the Google Form to contribute your answer. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click the BACK arrow on each slide to return to the definitions slide.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then repeat the process with the next word on the list.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You will be asked to test your knowledge of these words again shortly, so take your time reading through the definitions and coming up with examples.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youve finished reading the definitions and giving examples of all the words, click NEXT to continue." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Now lets talk about Dual Coding. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If you read the definition, you know that dual coding is the practice of combining two forms of media to describe a word. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="This could be text and a picture, text and audio, audio and a picture or text and video, just to name a few. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Were going to be looking at two ways to encourage students to use dual coding to practice vocabulary.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to find out how.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Google Sites allows students to collaborate in order to create a website in real time. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="We are going to use the new Google Sites to create an illustrated dictionary using the vocabulary terms from our lesson. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click on a word from the navigation menu on the Google Sites page to go to a sub-page. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="On that page, insert an image that represents the word and insert a text box where you will type in a definition of the term in your own words and provide an example that illustrates the meaning.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You only need to do this for one word, but you are welcome to repeat this process for as many words as you like. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When you do this with your students, you can assign specific students to create sub-pages for different words, or group them and have each group create an illustrated dictionary of their own. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre finished, click NEXT to continue.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Google Slides also allows students to collaborate in real-time, however instead of a website, using Google Slides, students can work together to create a presentation. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In this case, instead of a presentation, we are going to use Google Slides to create digital flashcards so that we can use them as a study tool. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Pick a word from your course vocabulary and add a new slide to the presentation. Choose any word you like from your discipline.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Type in your word in the title space and add an animation (fade-in on click). 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then insert an image of your word and type the definition in the text box. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click present to view the results.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre finished, click NEXT to continue.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="For our last activity, lets talk about Elaboration. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Elaboration is expanding on a word or concept in order to make as many connections as possible to your prior knowledge. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Simply put, elaboration is talking about a word until you exhaust your knowledge of the subject. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Now lets look at a fun way to get students to practice Elaboration.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to continue.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Now lets test your knowledge. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="How well do you understand these important vocabulary concepts? 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Take the quiz and click SUBMIT on the form to check your understanding.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre finished, click NEXT to learn more techniques you can use in your vocabulary instruction.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="You completed the first module of the Vocabulary Instruction and Techniques course. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click NEXT to return to the home screen.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then continue on to Module Two: Vocabulary Techniques to learn more techniques you can use to teach vocabulary.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="OR
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click Test Your Knowledge to check your understanding of the principles and techniques with a Scenarios quiz. 
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Congratulations! You made it to the final assessment! 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="On the form, you will be presented with 3 different scenarios of instructors that want to introduce, practice or review vocabulary. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Choose the most appropriate technique for each of the 3 scenarios and explain your reasoning. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Be as detailed as possible and BE SURE to include the vocabulary principles and concepts discussed in this module to support why the techniques and methods of facilitation you choose will be effective.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When youre finished, click SUBMIT and contact Mike to receive your final score. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="After you complete the assessment, click NEXT to return to the home screen. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
